attributes.action: Take action to repair and restore the U.K. road system.
attributes.additional_details:
The state of the roads in the U.K. is a national disgrace and the pot holes are dangerous for all drivers, passengers, motor bike riders, cyclists and pedestrians. 

The Health and safety of all our citizens must be a priority for government. It is not good enough to say we don’t have the funds to keep our citizens safe.
attributes.background: In 1936 riadfund licence was introduced as a way of funding the road system throughout the U.K. The system changed and insufficient funds are being made available for essential maintenance of our roads.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask the Government to reintroduce a specific road fund for the maintenance of the UK road network, if that's what you'd like to happen. 

If you want vehicle tax to include a levy for the repair of roads maintained by local authorities, you may wish to sign this petition instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/217189
